sentences.sContent: Careers Officers maintain contact with young people when they have left school.
sentences.sCn: 年轻人离开学校以后，职业指导员和他们保持联系。

sentences.sContent: Britain wants to maintain its position as a world power.
sentences.sCn: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。

sentences.sContent: A lot depends on building and maintaining a good relationship with your customers.
sentences.sCn: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要，很多事情要取决于此。

sentences.sContent: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
sentences.sCn: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。

sentences.sContent: How can we maintain control of spending?
sentences.sCn: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

sentences.sContent: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
sentences.sCn: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

sentences.sContent: ...Another reason why teachers should maintain a formal students with their students is to avoid real and perceived bias...
...One reason to maintain a formal distance between students and teachers is to highlight the instructor’s role as an authority figure...
...relies on that steady flow to maintain its economy...
...In the absence of societal pressures to maintain pair-bonds...
...Attracting the brightest and most ambitious postgraduate and research students is critical if the UK is to maintain its quality reputation for research...
...while still trying to maintain its soul...
...strong will is an important condition or role of the success the individual should desire to maintain forever...
...Although some magazines will maintain national audiences...
...By six o'clock that evening I had signed contracts with seven companies to rent plants from me and pay me a fee to maintain them...

synos.tran: 维持；继续；维修；主张；供养

remMethod.val: main(主要) ＋ tain(保持)  → 保持大体上的完好 → 维持； 维修

words.tran: 可维持的；可主张的；可维修的
维护，维修；保持；生活费用

trans.tranOther: to make something continue in the same way or at the same standard as before
